After no word from Lewis on the matter, the ex-TOWIE star has broken his silence admitting to the Valentine's Day romp. 
He released a statement on his Twitter page which read: "I am utterly disappointed in myself for hurting such an amazing girl, she did not deserve any of the pain I have caused. 
"It was a drunken mistake, a terrible thing I wish I had the courage to just admit my wrong doing so Marnie did not have to find out from these girls. 
"I was with Marnie for the right reasons. A lot of the stuff that's been said is lies.

TWITTER SHUTDOWN: Aaron quickly stood up for his ex 
"That doesn't change the fact of what I have done. 
"You all have the right to think badly of me. Today, I think worse of myself than any one you possibly can. 
"Marnie is a great girl and I am clearly a fool for ruining what was something special." Marnie didn't respond to the seemingly heartfelt apology but her ex-boyfriend Aaron Chalmers soon leaped to her defence. 
Retweeting the 27-year-old's apology, Aaron commented: "Why don't you start by paying back some of the 20-25k you sponged off her."
